attributes.action: Require all schools to teach children about the severity of acid attacks.
attributes.background: We have recently seen increasing numbers in the amount of these life-changing acid attacks. For example, in 2012 the attack of Naomi Oni, who had acid chucked on her whilst walking through London. Since, 2012 acid attacks have doubled. It is vital that we educate children about this danger.
attributes.additional_details: Last year there were more than 450 acid attacks in London alone. Many have argued to make the sale of acids more regulated and that you should no longer to be able to 'buy it over the counter' however I do not think this is how we should tackle this problem. By further regulating the sale of acids we will not stop the problem directly, however by educating our youth on the effects of these life-changing attacks, we will hopefully see a decrease in the number of attacks in areas such as London.

attributes.action: Revoke Independent Schools' Charitable Status
attributes.background: Over the next 5 years the public will Subsidize £522 million in tax breaks to private schools in which 7% of the wealthy few attend. This is thanks to their status as charities. We call on the government to remove charitable status,  and thus taxpayer support,  from fee-paying schools

attributes.action: Allow all UK citizens to have a free NHS flu jab from September 2018 onwards
attributes.background: Many people considered 'at risk' are fortunate enough to be vaccinated for free, however not everybody is. The recent outbreak has caused lots of people to suffer and even more strain on the NHS. It is counterproductive to deny the flu jab to 'healthy' people as we are not invincible and do get flu.
attributes.additional_details:
It is possible to pay to have the jab at a pharmacy, but they are not all equal. Some are better than others.

'For otherwise healthy people, flu can be very unpleasant.' - NHS Choices. They acknowledge this is the case for those deemed not to be at risk, yet still do not offer us protection. 

'The surge sparked fresh pleas from doctors for the millions of people who have not had the winter flu jab, including those at particular risk from the virus, to get immunised urgently.' - The Guardian

attributes.action: Remove Parabens,Artificial Colour,Flavour & Preservatives from Infant Medication
attributes.background: Make all pharmaceutical companies removed parabens, all artificial colours, flavours and preservatives currently found in liquid medications, primarily used by parents for young children and especially babies. Babies should definitely not be exposed to parabens in this way.
attributes.additional_details:
Parabens have been proven to adversely affect the reproductive systems in rats and have no place in childrens medications

There is evidence that parabens and para- hydroxybenzoic acid may act as oestrogenic endocrine disruptors. Source below:
http://www.breastcanceruk.org.uk/science-and-research/parabens/
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/ruth-romano/parabens-and-breast-cance_b_15963020.html
They should not be contained in product given to babies i.e. immature reproductive system/pre puberty

attributes.action: Electrocardiogram (ECG) scans should be made compulsory for all young people.
attributes.background: Test every teenager for deadly undiagnosed heart defects that kills 12 people every week in the UK. 80% of heart defects are found through ECG scans, as there are no symptoms - meaning hundreds of lives would be saved each year. One in 500 people suffer and their hearts could stop at any point.
attributes.additional_details: Renowned cardiologist Professor Sanjay Sharma, medical director for the virgin London Marathon and Professor of Cardiology at St George's University Hospital, agrees saying: 'Each week 12 young people in the UK die suddenly from a heart condition they didn't know they had.' 'The vast majority of those - more than 80% - won't have symptoms, but the same proportion would have been picked up through a three minute ECG.'

attributes.action: Ban knives longer than 4 inches.
attributes.background:
No person needs a knife longer than 4 inches. If this law is passed then the UK will have a reduction in crime. 
Please sign the petition to make the UK a safer place.

attributes.action: Create an international phone number for UK emergency services.
attributes.background: There have been cases in the media of people attempting suicide over live streaming on social media sites or posing a danger to themselves online. These situations have been streamed internationally but people in foreign countries are not able to report these incidents in the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: An international UK emergency service number, I believe, is vital and would allow for people abroad to report an incident first hand and potentially speed up the response to incidents of such a nature.

attributes.action: Include tax exempt income in child maintenance payments.
attributes.background: Child maintenance payments do not include tax-exempt income. For example, a parent who was injured in war can receive thousands of pounds per month in tax-exempt pension. Of this they would only have to pay a few pounds per week to their child.
attributes.additional_details: How is it ok that the government remove financial responsibility for children when it can clearly be afforded?

attributes.action: Make Mental health check ups free and compulsory yearly for anyone
attributes.background: Mental health is stigmatised so not enough people are getting the help they need by reaching out. So many people have died because of this. I want to make it compulsory to have a yearly mental health check up so everyone can get the support that they deserve.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public transport (buses) to be fitted with seatbelts.
attributes.background: In light of the two elderly ladies who were recently injured on a public transport bus.

attributes.action: Ban import of all Burmese products to the UK
attributes.background:
Discriminatory government policies and militry violance in Mayanmar have compelled 600,000 Rohingya's to fled their homes to Bangladesh.

Violations of human rights, including burning villages, killings, raping, torturing women & children, ethnically cleansing Burma of Rohingya population.
attributes.additional_details:
Rohingya are Muslim minority group. They differ from Myanmar’s dominant Buddhist groups ethnically, linguistically, and religiously.

The government refuses to grant the Rohingya citizenship, as a result they have no legal documentation, effectively making them stateless. Myanmar’s 1948 citizenship law was already exclusionary, and the military junta, which seized power in 1962, introduced a law twenty years later stripping the Rohingya of access to full citizenship.

attributes.action: Put grammar schools in all counties
attributes.background: Lots of high school children are held back in their current schools. If they go to a grammar school they will be encouraged, pushed, and will improve greatly!

attributes.action: More funding for the National Health Service and take it out of crisis
attributes.background: I have seen casualty departments where people are begging for help, I've seen where patients are being kept in corridors and I've seen nurses and doctors struggle to provide the appropriate care required when they are stretched to their limit.

attributes.action: Introduce compensation  for misleading people to buy diesel cars
attributes.background: We were told to buy diesel cars a few years ago and now we are being told to buy electric cars. If you have a diesel car you have to pay to enter into London when the government were the ones who told us to get diesel cars as they are better. I think we should get money from the government for this
attributes.additional_details: I believe we should get compensation for this as we were told to buy diesel cars and now we have to pay extra for someone's mistake

attributes.action: Reverse the planned ban on letting agent fees to tenants
attributes.background: The UK Government is currently putting a bill through Parliament to ban letting agents or landlords from charging any fees to tenants for renting a home. This ban will likely put costs to tenants up so we would like to see it reversed before primary legislation is passed as a cap is more appropriate
attributes.additional_details: A ban on fees to tenants will simply push these costs onto landlords who are a long way from all being able to afford them. This will drive up rents and drive down standards and, crucially, reduce supply as landlords are squeezed on top of recent tax changes. Asking prospective tenants to make a reasonable contribution to the vetting process is in no way unreasonable and a cap is a perfectly workable compromise. The Government’s broken housing policy needs private landlords right now.

attributes.action: Lower the price of road tax for petrol and increase the price for diesel
attributes.background: It is said that Diesel cars emit more harmful pollutants, why should road tax be so much cheaper for diesel? it only encourages more people to use diesel.

attributes.action: To be compulsory for dog owners to muzzle their dogs if using extendable lead
attributes.background: A cat on my street was sleeping on his windowsill an elderly lady came onto the street with her dog on one of these leads. The dog was at least 15ft in front of lady went between a car saw the cat and fatally attacked and killed the cat, because she didn't have full control of her animal.

attributes.action: Prevent UK universities classifying British citizens as international students.
attributes.background:
Currently, a British citizen must live in the UK for the 3 years before starting university. This discriminates against citizens who have lived abroad. 

The loose fee-status specifications allow for different institutions to classify the same student as an international and a home student.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite being a British citizen, I am currently paying £20,000 per year to attend Durham University. 

The Department for Education justifies this by claiming British Citizens who have lived abroad have no access to public funds when they return to the UK, but there is no equivalent barrier to benefits, the NHS, or similar means of public funds. 

This is a call to end the discrimination, not a request to access the Students Loan Company. This is a demand to be treated as equal.

attributes.action: Create a register of people banned from keeping animals in the UK
attributes.background: Bans on keeping animals are currently unenforcible as no national register exists. This petition argues that a national register should be created listing all individuals who have been convicted of animal cruelty and banned from keeping animals.
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see a government website created that breeders and pet shops can use to search a database of people banned from keeping animals this is the only way we  can stop these convicted people from purchasing and possibly neglecting another  animal!

attributes.action: Make it a criminal act for any British politician to lie or deceive UK citizens
attributes.background: Politicians seem to be able to say what they want without being held to account, if there was some kind of criminal action that can be taken to insure a little bit more truth in their actions and words. Perhaps this force them to be honest with the British public.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to have alcohol at school events in which children are present.
attributes.background: Alcohol plays far too big a part in society as it is. Alcohol is a grown up thing that children should not be part of. By having alcohol at children's school events we are not only weakening the safeguarding of the children attending, but also showing them that we drink to have a good time.
attributes.additional_details:
Adults should be leading by good example. You can't teach responsible drinking while drinking in front of them. It should be respected that there are parents that want to raise their children in alcohol free environments. 
1 in 5 children are affected by a parents drinking this also needs to be taken into consideration, for some of those children school is a safe and fun environment. 
There is no argument for alcohol at schools, other than "we want it" However there are many disadvantages to it.

attributes.action: Remove all benefit caps on Kinship/sgo carers
attributes.background: Across the country kinship carer are struggling because of benefit caps leaving most of them worse off than they would be if they never took on these children. It would cost more to keep them in care make payments to these wonderful people more inline  with foster carers or please  remove the caps.

attributes.action: Fund free travel on public transport for all students in England.
attributes.background: Students do not earn money and yet have to pay for travel. This is not fair and many cannot afford it. Students are normally travelling to school/ college and shouldn't have to pay for this. This is why we feel that all students should have free travel and we urge you to sign it.

attributes.action: Make a law on age for babysitting and being left home alone
attributes.background: As confusing as it is some people think it's wrong to let teenagers under 16 look after their siblings or other young children, whilst others see no harm As it can be good to trust these days and at other times there are risks..
attributes.additional_details:
Do we educate our children how to deal with emergencies when they arise or how to cook their own food without setting fire to the kitchen.
Just think a law should be in place to protect not only the children but others around and make it a legal age to babysit

attributes.action: Require all businesses who sell food to provide dairy alternatives
attributes.background: A growing number of children are being daignosed with dairy intolerance. Wouldn't it be nice to stop at your local ice cream parlour and be able to buy a dairy alternative ice cream or take your diary intolerant child out for a milkshake at any cafe without having to check with them first?
attributes.additional_details: Seems such a small thing but trying to explain to a little boy he can't have an ice cream on the seafront but the other children can is heart breaking. I believe it's about time businesses were forced to supply an alternative to dairy to meet the growing needs of intolerant children and adults.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for food products to have carbon print and water usage labels
attributes.background:
The current rate of climate change is having devastating effects on the planet with natural disasters becoming more commonplace.
Some food products are much more carbon and water intensive in production than others and having these labels will allow us to be more informed.
attributes.additional_details:
With around 10% of the UK’s carbon emissions in 2016 coming from domestic agriculture https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/679334/2016_Final_Emissions_Statistics_one_page_summary.pdf
we should consider ways in which to reduce this.

Companies like Tesco once opted to add carbon labels to some food products on a voluntary basis; however, they then dropped this policy in part due to other retailers failing to follow suit.

attributes.action: Minimum 5 year sentence for possession of Offensive Weapons in a public place.
attributes.background: The current sentencing tariffs are insufficient and ineffective as a deterrent. On first offence, a minimum sentence of 6 months custody which may be suspended for 5 years, depending on specific circumstance. On second offence, a minimum sentence of 5 years custody, with no option of early release.
attributes.additional_details:
Current CPS sentencing guidance for 16-17 year olds, is set to 4 months minimum detention and a training order, in the worst scenarios: ( https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/offensive-weapons-knives-bladed-and-pointed-articles ) Clearly, this is not a deterrent.
The proposed tariffs would apply to all ages. To ensure the new tariffs are clear, a campaign to publicise them to the target audience (10 years old and above suggested) should be conducted through National & local media.

attributes.action: An accepted offer on a house is a binding contract, withdrawal incurs 5% penalty
attributes.background: When we bought our house, the vendor withdrew at the last minute and selling our current house, more than one buyer withdrew at the last minute and in each case, leaving us with considerable inconvenience and unforeseen financial consequences. This will stop chains collapsing.

attributes.action: Require 5-year warranty on electrical goods to reduce environmental impact
attributes.background: White goods, TVs and other electrical items often break shortly after their warranty has expired and are often not economically viable to repair. Manufacturers should have to take greater care to ensure these items are better quality and fit for use for many years to reduce the environmental impact.

attributes.action: Free prescription charges in England
attributes.background:
Why should people in England be charged for prescriptions?
Why can the rest of the "United Kingdom" be exempt the same as Wales Scotland, Northern Ireland.
This is direct discrimination against anyone living in England.

attributes.action: Refuse to take part in war in Syria and find a diplomatic path to peace
attributes.background: Bombing Syria will not help the situation. It will kill more civilians and ignite a conflict that could spiral out of control, causing massive devastation. We call on the government to refuse to engage in the conflict. Focus on political solutions and aiding diplomacy between the US and Russia
attributes.additional_details: A conflict in Syria between U.S. and Russian forces is not only something that we cannot afford to take part in, it's something we should do everything in our power to prevent. The potential consequences of such a conflict - a huge civilian death toll and the risk of igniting nuclear war - are things that need to be avoided at all costs. We urge the government not to take part in any military action in Syria but instead, with urgency, focus all available resources on finding political solutions and aiding diplomatic relations between the U.S. and Russian governments.

attributes.action: Change the A1 license - Motorcycle
attributes.background: My suggested change is if you are 18+ Years old and obtain an A1 license you can ride a motorcycle up to a 300cc with no power greater than 23 kw (30 bhp) Restrictions can be placed on the bike. This will give people an incentive to obtain this license. Making more people do motorcycle training.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can obtain an A1 license at 17+ Years old Which allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) you no longer display L plates, you can carry a pillion and have access to the motorway. 

Cbt allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) as long as you display L plates front and back, don’t Carry pillions and don’t go onto the motorway.

17 year olds have no restriction on what car they can drive after passing.

attributes.action: Require drivers aged 70 + to undergo an annual road safety check and eye exam.
attributes.background: I propose that all drivers aged 70 and over should have to have annual safety assessment by a qualified driving instructor, and an eye examination by an optometrist, both of whom will submit a report to the DVLA to allow them to hold their license for the following twelve months.

attributes.action: Allow Ambulances on non-emergency journeys to use Bus Lanes.
attributes.background: Make a nationwide policy to allow NHS Ambulances on non-emergency journeys to use Bus Lanes at all times. This would recognise that Ambulance journeys are important.  Ambulances sitting in queues of traffic while Bus Lanes are free doesn't make much sense. This would save the NHS money.
attributes.additional_details: NHS ambulances are a form of public transport & should have the same right to use Bus Lanes as Buses & Taxis.

attributes.action: Repair pot holed roads by introduction of vignette system for foreign drivers
attributes.background: Many countries in Europe make road users pay to use motorways and major roads, either by way of tolls or a vignette system. I propose introducing a Vignette system in the UK for foreign drivers which would raise revenue to be shared amongst the counties and used solely for repairing road surfaces.
attributes.additional_details: Pot holes in UK roads are increasing due to councils lack of funds for repairs. This causes serious safety issues for drivers and cyclists and can cause major damage to vehicles.

attributes.action: Raise the Penalty for Uninsured Motorists
attributes.background: Currently the penalty for driving a motor vehicle with no insurance is £300 and 6 points on your license. With this being the case, millions of motorists take the gamble!
attributes.additional_details:
If you are involved in a road traffic accident that was not a fault of your own, usually the third party’s insurance would cover the damage to your vehicle and your insurance excess. If however, the third party is an uninsured driver, this then falls on you to recover your costs. 

Millions of motorists are uninsured because the penalty for doing so is not severe enough. A £300 fine is cheaper than most annual insurance quotes!

The fine should be more severe to prevent this from happening.

attributes.action: Mandatory weekly hour classes in current politics in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Give secondary school children a chance to learn about the different parties in the UK and their policies (etc) from an unbiased perspective. Learn about current affairs both locally and abroad, voting etc. Give everyone the right to unbiased knowledge to make well informed decisions as adults.
attributes.additional_details: I propose hour classes once a week in order to keep children engaged and updated. Teach the requirements for voting, the process of voting, current party policies for each party, practice voting etc. Engage in current debates and learn of foreign affairs that affect both the UK and the world. Allow them the advantage of awareness when coming to the voting age for both fair and thoroughly considered decisions. Studying Holocaust Literature in my degree has inspired me to propose this.

attributes.action: Amend Highways act 1980 to allow electric powered motorcycles to use motorways
attributes.background: Recent developments have created high powered electric motorcycles, but as they do not have an engine with a capacity exceeding 50cc they are excluded from motorway travel. I propose that the Highways Act be amended to change the wording defining a motorcycle by power output not by engine capacity.
attributes.additional_details:
Highways act 1980 schedule 4 Classes of Traffic for Purposes of Special Roads
The Motorways traffic (England and wales) Regulations 1982

attributes.action: Increase armed forces budget
attributes.background: We believe that the armed forces are receiving too little in budget and pay. and we believe that they should get more money due to the fact that everyday their life is put on the line.

attributes.action: Abolish university fees
attributes.background: We want to abolish university fees as they are causing people to miss out on education and potentially life changing careers. The fact that people cant get the proper education to become a doctor or lawyer etc. isn't fair as it means that only the wealthy can achieve the careers they want.
attributes.additional_details:
Tuition fees at public university are at the highest on average. This means that 17772 people can't afford to go to university. 

Since 1998 university fees have been drastically rising, starting at £1000 and then in 2006 they rose to £3000 and recently have been raised to £9000 a year on average.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Business Rates for Small Businesses
attributes.background: Business Rates in this country are driving existing Businesses into debt and liquidation, preventing them from expanding and new Businesses from forming. The extortionate cost of Business Rates are set far too high and there is very little help available and no incentive for Local Councils to help
attributes.additional_details: To run a Business, premises are often required. Different types of Businesses have different requirements. For example, a Small Office Business may run with low Business Rates and a high turn-over. Where as a Small Manufacturer may require a much larger premises, huge Business Rates, and have a smaller profit margin. We need a fairer and balanced Business Rates system that works for the different types of Businesses, because at the moment it is killing our Small Businesses and preventing growth

attributes.action: Make snow days a compulsory paid day off
attributes.background: We are asking the government to make snow days a compulsory paid day off we ask that under a amber warning for snow that if you cannot get into work or the company that you work for does not trade that we are paid for it

attributes.action: Ban diesel cars, post-Brexit
attributes.background: Diesel NOx cheating kills 23,500 UK people a year prematurely, at 10 times the USA’s gun death rate. The UK cannot wait 23 years and see 540,500 die early. We must follow the Germans and ban diesels immediately Post-Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
Last July, the UK banned diesel cars by 2040, because EU diesel testing failure had worsened breaching of NOx targets. Many German cities exceed EU limits. So, last February, Germany’s highest court ruled that cities can ban the worst diesels.

Car makers and politicians move between both spheres in Germany, the major EU budget contributor. It got EU CO2 regulations to favour diesel, ignoring NOx. VW cheated on emission testing. With 3 jailed, police are investigating 3 of VW’s top people.

attributes.action: Bring Home The QE2
attributes.background:
The QE2 was the last of the great liners build on Clydeside. 
In 2008 it was sold to a company in Dubai, since then it has been sitting in a dock rotting with no work been carried out on it.
I think the British Government should purchase the ship and bring it back to the Clyde. Where it Belongs.

attributes.action: Debate the protection of vulnerable people from excessive insurance renewals
attributes.background:
The government needs to protect elderly and vulnerable people who are unable to look for and change to more competitive deals with alternative insurance providers for home insurance.

Which may result in the elderly person and property not being insured as the excessive cost is prohibitive
attributes.additional_details: I have personal experience of a number of elderly persons receiving excessive home insurance renewal premiums which were five times market rate. This is due to the insurance company's understanding that the elderly could be without internet access or otherwise isolated and would find it difficult or indeed impossible to move to cheaper alternative providers - and therefore incumbent insurance companies inflate renewals and any subsequent offers as there is no independent oversight available.

attributes.action: Stop schools being able to confiscate phones for more than the shool day.
attributes.background: Many schools confiscate phones if they are seen or heard. However the problem arises when schools confiscate a phone overnight or sometimes over multiple days. Kids should have right to bring their phones to school and also take them back at the end of the day.
attributes.additional_details: Our school has created a rule where if any phone makes a noise or is seen during the school day (including break) it will be confiscated and you will have to collect at the end of the following day. This is also the case in many other schools. Due to kids signing a 'home school agreement' which apparently gives them the right to do this. The government should assign rules that restrict schools from being allowed to take phones over night.

attributes.action: Require schools to start at 9:30 and end at 3:30.
attributes.background: Children find it extremely difficult to wake up at 7:30 and get to school by 8 or 8:30. Most children hate coming to school because of the time you have to wake up. An extra hour of sleep helps retain information and helps the child perform better at school.
attributes.additional_details: Starting school at 9:30 and ending it at 3:30 gives us 6 hours of education where students are actually awake in lessons because they have had enough time to sleep.

attributes.action: Legally enforce an opt-out solution for paper publications sent by organisations
attributes.background: Universities, schools, and professional bodies frequently post paper journals and other publications to their members. These are usually unsolicited, and often thrown away unread. In the era of online technology, they are a waste of public and private money, and needlessly damage the environment.
attributes.additional_details: It would be very simple to create a central website (one could be built at very little expense), to which these large organisations must have a log in.  Individuals could then record their wish to unsubscribe from monthly paper publications (by organisation): expressing their mailing frequency preference, or requesting online issues instead.  The government should compel these organisations to have a membership to this system, and to respect the preferences of those receiving these publications.

attributes.action: Stop Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays
attributes.background: Bus time on bank holiday is same Sunday. Many local councils make money using bus lane on bank holiday. Their actions is not benefit to our society.

attributes.action: No transfer of powers to councils to fine motorists for minor traffic offences
attributes.background: Town halls want to rake in more cash by securing sweeping new powers to impose fines on motorists for minor traffic offences.  The Local Government Association want government to transfer powers to them that are currently only available to the police.
attributes.additional_details: The Local Government Association have already started the process of lobbying government in the form of the Department of Transport.  They believe that they are better suited to this enforcement than the police.  This has already been rejected once, but they are continuing to put pressure on government for the change.  We already know that local government isn't about making things safer it's purely a revenue raising exercise and again the motorist is yet again being seen as a cash cow.
